sentences.text: C O M 23
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Company Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net income  decreased 8.0% to  $692.2 million Revenue  remained flat at  $6.0 billion Diluted  earnings per share  increased 3.8% Dividends per share  increased by 13% Financial Services  operating income  decreased by 1.7%  to $275.5 million Discretionary company  share repurchases  $459.1 million  versus $1.5 billion*  in 2015
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * Funded by $750 million debt issuance in 2015
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, Harley-Davidson achieved several milestones in its strategy to drive demand by growing  new ridership in the U.S., increasing product and brand awareness and access, and accelerating  the cadence and impact of new products.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among these milestones, we retained and improved upon  our #1 market share position in the U.S.; maintained leading market shares in critical international  markets; added 40 new dealerships to our international dealer network; trained more than  65,000 riders in the U.S. through the Harley-Davidson Riding Academy; and launched the powerful  new Milwaukee-Eight engine on our touring motorcycles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our investments in driving demand and  product innovation generated positive responses and helped offset the full effects of the intense  global competitive environment, including the unexpected decline in the U.S. motorcycle industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While we expect the current competitive environment will continue, we believe we are well positioned  to navigate through it and deliver on our long-term strategy to build the next generation of Harley- Davidson riders and grow share and profit globally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2016 full-year results adversely affected executive compensation for 2016 because our  compensation is focused on pay for performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we did not fully meet our specific financial  goals and performance objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, payouts to executives were below target under our  short-term incentive plan and our cash-based long-term incentive awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2 0 1 6  E X E C U T I V E  C O M P E N S AT I O N  S U M M A R Y
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To further strengthen the link between executive compensation and our strategic objectives, for 2016  we revised our approach to executive compensation by increasing the level of compensation that is at  risk and dependent on performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Of particular note, in 2016, we reconfigured our long-term incentive plan by placing a greater portion  of compensation at risk to better align long-term rewards with long-term value that shareholders  realize.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our changes included eliminating the use of stock options and cash-based long-term  incentive awards as elements of our long-term incentive plan, which we replaced with performance  shares to provide a more direct connection between performance relative to key measures and the  rewards that result from that performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continue to use restricted stock units for one-third of  our long-term incentive plan and use performance shares for the remaining two-thirds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HARLEY-DAVIDSON, INC. 2 0 1 7  P R O X Y  S TAT E M E N T 24
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: E X E C U T I V E  C O M P E N S AT I O N
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our long-term incentive plan, the amounts that executives will earn through performance shares  that we granted in 2016 will depend on our performance relative to certain performance objectives over  a three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Importantly, for 2016, we factored a new performance measure into our long-term  incentive plan through the performance shares - increasing the percentage of first-time motorcycle  purchasers in the U.S. buying new Harley-Davidson motorcycles (weighted at 15%) - while retaining  measures based on net income and return on invested capital (weighted at 42.5% each).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Short-Term Incentive Plan, or STIP , remained relatively unchanged.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Financial STIP , which  is formula-based, provides most of our approximately 6,000 employees, including our NEOs and  senior leaders, the opportunity to earn annual cash awards based upon achievement of specified  performance measures, which for 2016 included Corporate Net Income, HDMC Asset Productivity  and HDFS Return on Assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Leadership STIP provides senior leaders the opportunity to earn  annual cash awards in addition to the cash awards that they could earn under the Financial STIP .
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For  2016, we based our Leadership STIP upon achievement of specified goals relating to strengthening  the organizations development of lasting capabilities that can give our company a long-term  competitive advantage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our approach to base salaries and employee benefits remained relatively unchanged.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We benchmark  executive base salaries to market and base them on individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We generally provide  executive benefits in a manner similar to our salaried employee population except as we discuss below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table provides an executive summary of our 2016 executive compensation programs:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2 0 1 6  E x e c u t i v e  C o m p e n s a t i o n  S u m m a r y  Ta b l e
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Base  Salary We establish base salaries for our employees, including  executives in a group of approximately the top 35 senior  leaders in the company, by starting with market reference  points that approximate the competitive market 50th  percentile and making adjustments based upon individual  performance, experience, market practice and the  potential for advancement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provides fixed compensation, in line  with our market peer groups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Financial  Short-Term  Incentive Plan  (Financial STIP) Our Financial STIP , which is formula-based, provides  most of our approximately 6,000 employees, including  our senior leaders, the opportunity to earn annual  cash awards based upon achievement of specified  performance measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provides incentive to achieve  short-term financial goals and  other performance objectives  that management and the Board  determine to be important at the  beginning of the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leadership  Short-Term  Incentive Plan  (Leadership STIP) Our Leadership STIP provides our senior leaders the  opportunity to earn annual cash awards in addition  to the cash awards that they could earn under the  Financial STIP .
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, we based our Leadership STIP  upon achievement of specified goals relating to Project  Management Excellence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provides incentive to achieve  goals designed to develop lasting  company capabilities that give us a  competitive advantage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term  Incentive Plan Our long-term incentive plan provides our senior leaders  the opportunity to earn stock-based compensation based  on achievement of specified performance measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In  2016, we granted performance shares and restricted  stock units to our senior leaders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance shares  vest after completion of a three-year performance period  and only if performance merits the vesting of the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted stock units vest ratably over a three-year  period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provides long-term incentives  that are a key component of  total compensation the purposes  of which are to: (1) focus key  employees on our long-term  financial success and growth;  (2) align the interests of senior  leaders with those of shareholders;  and (3) encourage retention of  senior leaders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employee Benefits We provide the following additional benefits to our senior  leaders, which are available to all employees: medical,  dental, retirement benefits, deferred compensation, life  insurance, employee savings plans (401(k)), disability, paid  time off, employee purchase plan, clothing allowance and  relocation benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For senior leaders, we also provide  a supplemental retirement plan, executive physical plan  participation, a limited financial planning benefit, pay in  lieu of retiree life insurance and in very limited instances  personal use of the company aircraft.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provides a competitive level of  health, welfare and retirement  benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: H A R L E Y- D A V I D S O N .
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: C O M 25
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: E X E C U T I V E  C O M P E N S AT I O N
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe we have structured our compensation programs to support our company strategy,  to attain our business objectives, and to deliver significant shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The results of the  shareholder advisory vote on executive compensation at our 2016 Annual Meeting of Shareholders  were favorable, with 96.2% of the votes cast supporting our compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based upon  this high level of shareholder support, the Human Resources Committee believes we have strong  support from, and alignment with, our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Again, because we did not fully meet specific performance measures in 2016, executive payouts  were below target under our short-term incentive plan (STIP) and our cash-based long-term incentive  awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on our performance in 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Financial STIP payout was 87.1% of target;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Leadership STIP payout was 95.4% of target;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payout under cash-based long-term incentive awards relating to performance in 2014  through 2016 was 86.0% of target (we eliminated cash-based long-term incentive awards  from our executive compensation program beginning in 2016); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We currently project that the payout for performance shares that we granted in 2016 will  be 89.3% of target at the end of the three-year performance period in 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2017, we will continue to evaluate the effectiveness and alignment of our executive compensation  programs to ensure they continue to support our purpose, align to our strategy and support creation  of shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We discuss our executive compensation philosophy, policies, practices  programs, and performance in greater detail below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: E X E C U T I V E  C O M P E N S AT I O N  P H I L O S O P H Y
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Compensation Discussion and Analysis describes our executive compensation philosophy,  policies, practices, programs and performance for fiscal year 2016 and how they applied to our senior  leaders, including the following named executive officers, or NEOs, in 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Matthew S. Levatich, President and Chief Executive Officer, Harley-Davidson, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: John A. Olin, Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, Harley-Davidson, In
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lawrence G. Hund, President and Chief Operating Officer, Harley-Davidson  Financial Services
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Michelle A. Kumbier, Senior Vice President, Motor Company Product and Operations,  Harley-Davidson Motor Company
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Paul J. Jones, Vice President and Chief Legal Officer, Harley-Davidson, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation goals and guiding principles emphasize pay-for-performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We  base several elements of our compensation upon delivering high levels of performance relative to  performance measures that the Human Resources Committee has approved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the  annual Financial Short-Term Incentive Plan (STIP) and the performance shares that we granted for  the first time in 2016 require that we achieve significant financial performance before recipients are  entitled to this compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the equity component of our compensation program provides greater  financial benefits when our stock price is increasing; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the Leadership STIP generates payouts  correlated to driving measurable improvements in key capabilities that we believe are necessary for  improved performance and competitive advantage over time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our goals and guiding principles are  as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation program should create and reinforce pay for performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exceptional  performance should result in increased compensation, but missing performance goals  should result in reduced or no incentive pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HARLEY-DAVIDSON, INC. 2 0 1 7  P R O X Y  S TAT E M E N T 26
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: E X E C U T I V E  C O M P E N S AT I O N
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation program should encourage both the desired results and the right  behaviors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It should strike a balance so the company delivers near-term results that  drive long-term performance, while incorporating risk-mitigating features to ensure the  compensation program does not encourage excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation program should align the interests of management with the interests  of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A significant portion of executive compensation should be equity-based,  with required minimum stock ownership guidelines designed to appropriately focus our  management on long-term, sustainable growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation program should ensure our performance goals align with our strategy  and operating plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These performance goals should be challenging, yet achievable  during the applicable performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation program should provide a target total compensation opportunity that  keeps us competitive in our industry for the size and scale of our company, so we can  attract top executive talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation program includes a base salary, market  competitive employee benefits, targeted short-term incentive awards and long-term  incentive awards valued as of their grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although we have target compensation  levels, we employ flexibility and discretion so the company can attract and retain a highly- qualified and strong leadership team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional detail regarding our methodology for  benchmarking our compensation with other companies, see the below section entitled  Peer Group and Executive Compensation Benchmarking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: E X E C U T I V E  C O M P E N S AT I O N  P O L I C I E S  A N D  P R A C T I C E S
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Human Resources Committee has overall responsibility for approving the compensation of  our Harley-Davidson Leadership Team, which we refer to as the HDLT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our HDLT is a subset of  our senior leaders comprised of our CEO and executives who report directly to the CEO, including  all NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, the Human Resources Committee consisted of the following independent  directors: R. John Anderson, Michael J. Cave (Chair), George H. Conrades (through April 30, 2016),  Sara L. Levinson and Brian R. Niccol (effective September 7, 2016).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We describe the responsibilities and functions of the Human Resources Committee more fully in  the Corporate Governance Principles and Board Matters-Human Resources Committee section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Human Resources Committee has adopted the following policies, practices and  agreements to further the goals of the executive compensation program and to strengthen the  alignment of interests of executives with the long-term interest of shareholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: U s e  o f  A d v i s o r s  a n d  A d v i s o r  I n d e p e n d e n c e
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Human Resources Committee has the sole authority to engage the services of outside advisors,  experts and others to assist in performing its responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2010, the Committee has  retained Meridian Compensation Partners LLC as its outside executive compensation advisor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We  describe the independent advisors primary responsibilities and reporting obligations more fully in the  Corporate Governance Principles and Board Matters-Human Resources Committee section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During  2016, Meridian performed no services for the company beyond its engagement with the Human  Resources Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the Human Resources Committees Charter, if the Committee chooses to use a  compensation consultant, the consultant must be independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We consider an advisor to be  independent if the advisory firm does not provide services or products of any kind to the company or  any of its subsidiaries, the advisory firm does not derive more than 1% of its gross revenues from the  company and the advisory firm is precluded from providing any other services to the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee assessed Meridians independence, based in part on assurances and confirmation from  Meridian as to its independent status.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has concluded that Meridian had no conflicts and  believes that Meridian has remained independent throughout its engagement by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: H A R L E Y- D A V I D S O N .
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: C O M 27
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: E X E C U T I V E  C O M P E N S AT I O N
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A n t i - H e d g i n g  a n d  P l e d g i n g
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors and employees may not engage in hedging or pledging transactions with respect to  company securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain forms of hedging transactions, such as zero-cost collars and forward sale  contracts, allow a shareholder to lock in the value of his or her shareholdings, often in exchange for  all or a portion of any future appreciation in the stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The shareholder is then no longer exposed to  the full risks of stock ownership and may no longer have the same alignment as the companys other  shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, we prohibit such hedging transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Likewise, we prohibit pledging of the  companys securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: S t o c k  O w n e r s h i p
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, the Committee modified the Stock Ownership Guidelines applicable to senior  leaders to define the minimum ownership requirements by reference to a percent of annual base  salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee made the change to better align our requirements with those of companies in  our peer groups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The new guidelines, effective May 1, 2016, are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senior Leader Title Percent of Base Salary Chief Executive Officer 600% President/Chief Operating Officer - HDFS 400% Senior Vice President 300% Vice President or General Manager 200%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee monitors each senior leaders members progress toward, and continued compliance  with, the Stock Ownership Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted stock, restricted stock units, performance shares,  shares held in 401(k) accounts, vested unexercised stock options and stock appreciation rights, and  shares of common stock that senior leaders hold directly count toward satisfying the guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of  December 31, 2016, each NEO had met his or her stock ownership guideline requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes the Stock Ownership Guidelines are appropriate, market competitive and  provide for significant alignment of the interests of senior leaders with those of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ta l l y  S h e e t s
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To inform its decision-making process, the Committee reviews tally sheets that management and the  outside executive compensation advisor prepare.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tally sheets provide a comprehensive picture of the  current and historical compensation of each NEO by recounting in detail the dollar value of the total  compensation that we paid to each NEO for the past three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The total dollar value includes base  salary and short-term and long-term incentive compensation that we actually paid, and the costs we  incur to provide various health and insurance benefits and perquisites to our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The tally sheets  also reflect each NEOs accumulated realized and unrealized stock option gains, any vested and  unvested restricted stock or restricted stock unit awards and stock options at various stock values,  and any outstanding long-term cash awards at target value and the amounts our NEOs will receive if  they leave the company under various circumstances, such as retirement or termination in connection  with a change of control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that annual review of the tally sheets is helpful as  part of its process to oversee the design of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: C l a w b a c k s
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2010, Congress passed the Dodd-Frank Act, which requires many public companies to adopt  clawback policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the SEC has not yet issued the final regulations under the Act, the  Committee implemented a clawback policy in 2014 in anticipation of such SEC action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event  that any fraud or intentional misconduct by an executive officer was a contributing factor to the  company having to restate any financial statements filed with the SEC due to the companys material  noncompliance with any financial reporting requirement under the securities laws, then the Board  or the Committee may, in its discretion and to the extent permitted by governing law, require the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: E X E C U T I V E  C O M P E N S AT I O N
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: company to seek reimbursement or forfeiture of any eligible compensation paid or credited to or  earned by such executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of eligible compensation subject to forfeiture is any  eligible compensation in excess of the amounts that would have been paid or credited to or earned  by such executive officer during the three-year period preceding the date on which the company is  required to prepare the restatement based directly on the restated financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the purposes  of this policy, the term executive officer means any officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) designated as a Section 16 officer  under the federal securities laws or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) who has been designated an executive officer by the Board,  and the term eligible compensation means any bonuses paid or credited to or any other incentive  compensation earned by an executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once final regulations for the Dodd-Frank Act are published, the Committee intends to revise the clawback policy as necessary to comply with the Act and the final regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: E q u i t y  A w a r d  G r a n t s
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We make equity awards, such as restricted stock units and performance shares to certain employees  and directors, pursuant to a process that the Committee has approved and under a stock plan  that our shareholders have approved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual equity awards to employees historically have taken  place in February after the release of fourth quarter earnings at which time the window for  effecting transactions in our stock is generally open for those employees who may, through their job  responsibilities, have access to material non-public information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Off-cycle equity award grants may  only be effective on dates during an open window period and occur after the CEO determines that an  individual is deserving of an award because
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) an eligible employee is a recent hire;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) an employee  has excelled in his/her role,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) an eligible employee is promoted to a new position (which is stock  eligible);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) an eligible employee is highly valued and management wants to retain the individual;  or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) an eligible employee was inadvertently omitted from the annual award list.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For senior leaders  located outside the United States, we adjust our long-term incentives in a manner consistent with our  overall compensation philosophy to address local market tax, regulatory and competitive practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ta x  D e d u c t i b i l i t y
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code limits the tax deductibility of compensation that we pay  to NEOs (other than the chief financial officer) to $1,000,000 in any year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This limitation does not apply  to performance-based compensation if certain conditions are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Human Resources Committee  generally intends to maximize the extent of the tax deductibility of executive compensation under  the provisions of Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes, however, that shareholders interests are  best served by not restricting its discretion and flexibility in structuring compensation programs, even  though such programs may result in certain non-deductible compensation expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: S h a r e h o l d e r  A d v i s o r y  V o t e  -  S a y  o n  P a y
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2016 Annual Meeting of Shareholders, the Board requested and received shareholder approval,  on an advisory basis, of our 2015 executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We include this say on pay vote in  our proxy statement on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The results of the shareholder advisory vote on executive  compensation at our 2016 Annual Meeting of Shareholders were favorable, with 96.2% of the votes  cast voted in support of our compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to the date of that vote, we had already  made compensation decisions that impacted executive pay for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the high level of  shareholder support for our 2015 compensation program, the Committee kept in place for 2017  many of the same executive compensation elements that it had disclosed to shareholders in our proxy  statement for the 2016 Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: E m p l o y m e n t  a n d  Tr a n s i t i o n  A g r e e m e n t s
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We generally do not enter into employment contracts with executives that provide for ongoing terms  of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, we have transition agreements with Messrs. Levatich, Hund and Olin that  become effective upon a change of control of Harley-Davidson, Inc. as defined in their transition  agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the agreements with these NEOs, to the extent that payments to these executives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: under these agreements would be considered excess parachute payments as defined in Section  280G of the Internal Revenue Code, the payments will be reduced to a point at which they are no  longer considered excess parachute payments, or the executive will receive the full payment and be  personally liable for the excise tax, whichever produces the larger after-tax benefit to the executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are no provisions for an excise tax gross up or any provision for payment of benefits in the  event the executive voluntarily terminates his employment for any reason after a change of control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is no immediate vesting of equity awards upon a change of control for NEOs who are parties to  transition agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the circumstances that entitle an individual to payments upon termination of employment  following a change of control strike the appropriate balance between protecting the interests of our  shareholders and our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The table in the Payments Made Upon Termination - Change of  Control section provides estimates of the amounts of compensation payable to each eligible NEO, if  any, upon a change of control and termination of the executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The assumptions we used to calculate  those amounts accompany the Change of Control table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the transition agreements, a change of control of Harley-Davidson means any one of  the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the total number of directors either serving on the date of the agreement or approved by  those serving on the date of the agreement or successors they have approved no longer  constitutes at least two-thirds of the Board; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any person becomes the owner, directly or indirectly, of 20% or more of our outstanding  common stock or voting power; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the consummation of a merger or consolidation with another company, a sale of most of  our assets, or a liquidation or dissolution, unless, in the case of a merger or consolidation,  the total number of directors serving on the date of the agreement or approved by those  serving on the date of the agreement or successors they have approved will constitute  at least two-thirds of the board of the surviving company after the transaction; or at least  two-thirds of the total number of directors either serving on the date of the agreement  or approved by those serving as of the date of the agreement or successors they have  approved determines immediately before a proposed action is taken that the action will  constitute a change of control event (and the action is subsequently taken).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: E x e c u t i v e  S e v e r a n c e
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senior leaders, including the CEO and the other NEOs, are covered under our Executive Severance  Policy that provides for a cash severance benefit that varies between 12 and 24 months of base pay  and 18 months continuation of certain employee benefits, such as life insurance, medical benefits,  and limited outplacement benefits if we terminate employment for reasons other than for cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To  receive a severance payment under this policy, the executive must agree to a number of restrictive  covenants and execute a general release of claims against the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Group Cash Severance (months of base pay) Harley-Davidson Leadership Team (HDLT) 24 months Non-HDLT Senior Leaders 12 months
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: C o m p e n s a t i o n  R i s k  A s s e s m e n t
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Human Resources Committee considers, among other things in establishing and reviewing our  executive compensation program, whether the program pays the executives for performance and  whether the program encourages unnecessary or excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews  annually the principal components of executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salaries are reviewed annually  and adjusted as appropriate based on our pay-for-performance philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Financial STIP  incentive pay is focused on achievement of certain financial goals and is determined using multiple  performance criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our annual Leadership STIP in 2016 rewarded our executives for achievement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HARLEY-DAVIDSON, INC. 2 0 1 7  P R O X Y  S TAT E M E N T 30
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: E X E C U T I V E  C O M P E N S AT I O N
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: of progress towards and attainment of specific goals relating to delivery of large scale projects on time  and on budget.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual cash incentive plans provide that the Committee may reduce awards that  executives would otherwise earn by up to 50%, and there is a cap on all maximum cash payouts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  Committee believes these cash incentive plans appropriately balance risk, payment for performance  and the desire to focus executives on specific financial and leadership measures and that they do not  encourage unnecessary or excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The other major component of our executive compensation program is long-term incentives through  a mix of performance shares and restricted stock units that the Committee believes are important to  help further align executives interests with those of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes these  awards do not encourage unnecessary or excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of the equity-based awards  is tied to our stock price and performance shares are subject to maximum payouts (expressed as  a multiple of the original award).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, grants are subject to long-term, performance-based  vesting schedules, and executives are subject to stock holding requirements in the Stock Ownership  Guidelines, to help ensure that executives always have significant value tied to long-term performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Human Resources Committee believes that the structure of the Financial STIP , which focuses  behaviors on broad-based financial performance of the company as a whole, and the structure of  the long-term incentive plan, which rewards individuals for share price appreciation and performance  relative to strategic goals, achieve an appropriate balance of important objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee  also believes that the structures of these plans do not create risks that are reasonably likely to have a  material adverse effect on the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: P e e r  G r o u p  a n d  E x e c u t i v e  C o m p e n s a t i o n  B e n c h m a r k i n g
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee used two peer groups in benchmarking executive compensation practices and  levels for 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) one peer group consists of companies for whom manufacturing and engineering  are key attributes (Manufacturing/Engineering Peer Group) and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a second peer group consists of  companies for whom the maintenance of a strong product brand is a key attribute (Brand Name/ Consumer Goods Peer Group).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee uses blended compensation data from these two  peer groups to reflect the companys unique emphasis on both the maintenance of the Harley- Davidson brand and on manufacturing and engineering excellence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee  believes this use of blended compensation data is necessary to appropriately reflect the significantly  different compensation philosophies and practices of Brand Name/Consumer Goods companies and  Manufacturing/Engineering companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee selected peer companies for each of the two  peer groups based on revenues and because Harley-Davidson competes for executive talent with  these companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews compensation levels and reward practices of the companies within  the peer groups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When determining the competitive market using comparator company data,  we weight data from the Manufacturing/Engineering Peer Group 60% and data from the  Brand Name/Consumer Goods Peer Group 40%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If data from the peer groups is unavailable  or inadequate, then we determine the competitive market by using data obtained through the  Aon Hewitt 2016 U.S. Total Compensation Measurement (TCM) survey; you can find a list of all  of the companies in this survey by clicking on the Compensation Survey Participants link at  http://investor.harley-davidson.com/phoenix.zhtml?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee  believes that the regressed, weighted data derived from the two peer groups accurately reflects the  competitive market for executive compensation for our NEOs.

sentences.text: O U R  E X E C U T I V E  C O M P E N S AT I O N  P R O G R A M S  A N D
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our employees and our culture of leadership make our company great.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are in  competition to attract and retain talent primarily with companies for whom engineering, manufacturing  and the development of a strong global product brand and marketing focus are critical to their  businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive compensation program we developed and implemented enables us to  attract, retain, motivate and align our talent in a competitive talent marketplace.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation packages of our senior leaders, and more specifically our NEOs, consist of four  key elements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These primary elements are base salary, short-term incentives, long-term incentives and  employee benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In certain circumstances, such as newly-hired executives or for special recognition  or retention, we may provide compensation outside of these regular executive compensation  elements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, for senior leaders located outside the United States, we customize our compensation  and benefits to meet local market, tax, regulatory and competitive practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HARLEY-DAVIDSON, INC. 2 0 1 7  P R O X Y  S TAT E M E N T 32
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: E X E C U T I V E  C O M P E N S AT I O N
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: B a s e  S a l a r y
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We set base salaries by starting with salary midpoints that are generally at the competitive market  50th percentile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We then make adjustments to base salaries as appropriate and on a subjective basis  by individual, generally within a range of plus or minus 20%, based upon individual performance,  experience, market practices and potential for advancement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also take overall general business  and economic conditions, including market practices, into account in determining base salaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We  review base salaries for NEOs annually using the peer group and benchmarking data that we discuss  above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO recommends base salary changes for the Harley-Davidson Leadership Team to the Human  Resources Committee for final approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Human Resources Committee reviewed and approved  the salary increase recommendations of Mr. Levatich for the HDLT, excluding the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe  the increases to base salaries, which were effective March 2016, were appropriate based upon the  positioning of the executives base salaries in relation to the competitive market 50th percentile and  their individual performance, all in the manner that we describe above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective March 2016, we increased the base salary for our CEO based upon his individual performance, accomplishment of key initiatives and positioning of the CEOs base salary in relation to the competitive  market 50th percentile, as determined by the Human Resources Commitee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Human Resources  Committee believes the difference that exists between the base salary of the CEO and the base  salaries of the other NEOs is supported by competitive market data and is appropriate based upon  the level of accountability for his position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: S h o r t - Te r m  I n c e n t i v e  P l a n  ( S T I P )
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Short-Term Incentive Plan has broad-based employee participation and provides an opportunity  to most of our approximately 6,000 employees to earn annual cash awards based upon performance  during the course of our fiscal year relative to financial goals or other performance objectives that  we generally establish prior to the start of the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our senior leaders, including the NEOs, have the  opportunity to earn two types of annual incentive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We based one type on quantifiable,  objective factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We refer to this type of annual incentive compensation opportunity as our Financial  STIP .
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our senior leaders, including the NEOs, have the opportunity to receive payments  under an annual incentive plan that we refer to as our Leadership STIP , which is based upon driving  measurable improvement in key capabilities that we believe are necessary for improved performance  and competitive advantage over time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Human Resources Committee approved the Financial STIP and a Leadership STIP for 2016 under  the Harley-Davidson, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Short-Term Incentive Plan for Senior Executives, which shareholders approved  in 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual payments under the Financial STIP can range from 0% to 200% of an individuals  Financial STIP target opportunity based on actual company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Combined payouts under the  Financial and Leadership STIPs cannot exceed 200% of a participants Financial STIP target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2 0 1 6  F i n a n c i a l  S T I P
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In December 2015, the Human Resources Committee approved the 2016 Financial STIP consisting of  a single plan that covered all eligible employees rather than separate plans for Harley-Davidson Motor  Company, or HDMC, and Harley-Davidson Financial Services, or HDFS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee did this to  reinforce our One Company, One Team, One Direction philosophy, by aligning all eligible employees  on the same plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviewed and approved the 2016 performance measures and goals  under that plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: H A R L E Y- D A V I D S O N .
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: C O M 33
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: E X E C U T I V E  C O M P E N S AT I O N
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Human Resources Committee also reviewed and approved the target STIP opportunities for all  NEOs for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target STIP opportunity is the amount of STIP compensation that we would pay to a  NEO, expressed as a percentage of his or her annual base salary, assuming that the actual performance  resulted in a payout at target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based upon a review of competitive market data and our compensation  philosophy of targeting compensation at the 50th percentile plus or minus 20% based on individual  performance and experience, Mr. Levatich recommended the target STIP opportunities for each NEO  other than himself.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Financial STIP target opportunity for Ms. Kumbier was increased from 60% to  70%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For all other NEOs, the Committee approved 2016 STIP targets that were the same as in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Human Resources Committee determined the target STIP opportunity for the CEO based upon  a review of external market compensation data with input from the outside executive compensation  advisor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on that review and input, the Committee approved an increase in the CEOs Financial  STIP target opportunity from 115% of base salary to 125% of base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The key financial measures for the 2016 Financial STIP were the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consolidated Net Income (weighted at 75%): consolidated net income from  continuing operations, excluding the loss on debt extinguishment, the reinstatement of  the Research and Development tax credit and reorganization costs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HDMC Asset Productivity (weighted at 12.5%): revenue from HDMC divided by  the sum of HDMC average property, plant and equipment, net and average HDMC Net  Working Capital
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HDMC Net Working Capital: consolidated accounts receivables plus the sum of  HDMC current assets consisting of inventories and other current assets (excluding  tax assets) less the sum of current liabilities consisting of accounts payable  (excluding negative book cash balances) and accrued liabilities (excluding dividends  payable and tax liabilities)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HDFS Return on Assets (weighted at 12.5%): HDFS operating income divided by  HDFS average finance receivables, net
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These measures are derived from our financial results as presented in our consolidated financial  statements and notes, except that we use monthly information to calculate averages and our financial  statements and notes may not disclose detailed amounts for the excluded items because the details  are not required for financial statement reporting purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The rationale for using HDMC Asset Productivity and HDFS Return on Assets in conjunction with  Consolidated Net Income is to provide incentives relating to both the balance sheet and the income  statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These measures take into account the level of return on investment and net income, which  involve the magnitude and quality of earnings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believed the goals it established based  on HDMC Asset Productivity, HDFS Return on Assets and Consolidated Net Income were appropriate  and balanced and provided adequate incentive for participants to strive to achieve our objectives  for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2016 Financial STIP , we set the Consolidated Net Income target at $758.4 million, the HDMC  Asset Productivity target at 5.06 and the HDFS Return on Assets target at 4.13%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meeting all three  targets would result in a payout under the plan equal to 100% of the target STIP opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  Committee approved potential payout percentages ranging from 0% to 200% of the target STIP  opportunity for various levels of performance against these performance targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant would  have been eligible to receive the maximum potential payout if our performance met or exceeded  Consolidated Net Income of $834.2 million, HDMC Asset Productivity of 5.46 and HDFS Return on  Assets of 4.67%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HARLEY-DAVIDSON, INC. 2 0 1 7  P R O X Y  S TAT E M E N T 34
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: E X E C U T I V E  C O M P E N S AT I O N
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the 2016 Financial STIP , if we did not achieve net income of at least $530.9 million in 2016,  then we would not make any payouts, regardless of performance under other financial measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In  addition, the minimum payout could be 0% and the maximum payout could not exceed 200% of a  participants Financial STIP target opportunity, nor could such payout exceed $6 million per executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon the completion of the fiscal year, the Committee reviews the extent to which actual performance    compares to the defined performance goals for the Financial STIP .
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We typically pay STIP awards in  February after the prior years financial statement audit is complete and the Committee reviews and  approves earned amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has the right to reduce awards that senior leaders would  otherwise earn under the STIPs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on 2016 performance, during which we achieved Consolidated Net Income (as defined above)  of $701.8 million, HDMC Asset Productivity of 4.53 and HDFS Return on Assets of 3.85%, Financial  STIP participants, including the NEOs, earned incentive payments equal to 87.1% of their target  Financial STIP opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2 0 1 6  L e a d e r s h i p  S T I P
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In December 2015, the Human Resources Committee approved the Leadership STIP for 2016 that  covered our senior leaders, including our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Leadership STIP provided the opportunity to  earn an incentive payment above amounts that a senior leader could earn under the 2016 Financial  STIP .
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the maximum Leadership STIP opportunity for each NEO, other than Mr. Levatich,  was 30% of that executives base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Leadership STIP opportunity for Mr. Levatich was 40%  of his base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the maximum STIP payment under both the Financial STIP and the  Leadership STIP could not exceed 200% of an executives Financial STIP target opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This  change was made to ensure that in no event could the Financial STIP and Leadership STIP pay out  in excess of 200% of the executives Financial STIP target opportunity, which we determined is in line  with market practice, nor could such payout exceed $6 million per executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each NEO, including Mr. Levatich, was able to earn a Leadership STIP payment based upon  performance towards a predetermined set of measures relating to project management excellence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Leadership STIP utilized three measures, each weighted equally, which were:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Completion of project management training
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Project health of strategic projects
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Capital investment per plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Human Resources Committee reviewed the aggregate performance of the organization relating to  the three Leadership STIP measures and determined that that performance equated to 95.4% of the  target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, each participant earned a Leadership STIP equal to 95.4% of his or her Leadership  STIP target opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table illustrates the relationship among the Leadership STIP target opportunity, the  Financial STIP target opportunity and the maximum STIP payout (as a percentage of base salary):
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Named  Executive Officer 2016 Financial  STIP Target  Opportunity 2016 Leadership  STIP Target  Opportunity 2016 Maximum  STIP Opportunity* Matthew S. Levatich 125% 40% 250% Lawrence G. Hund 80% 30% 160% John A. Olin 80% 30% 160% Michelle A. Kumbier 70% 30% 140% Paul J. Jones 70% 30% 140%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: *Combined payouts under the Financial and Leadership STIPs cannot exceed 200% of the NEOs Financial STIP target opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, in the case of Mr. Levatich, his Financial STIP target opportunity is 125%, for a  maximum payment of 250% of his base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: H A R L E Y- D A V I D S O N .
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: C O M 35
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: E X E C U T I V E  C O M P E N S AT I O N
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2 0 1 7  S h o r t - Te r m  I n c e n t i v e  P l a n  D e s i g n
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In November 2016, the Committee approved the companys 2017 Financial STIP consisting of a  single annual plan for all eligible employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The key financial measures for the 2017 Financial STIP are the following, in each case subject to  certain adjustments that the Committee may approve, with the relative weightings that the Committee  assigned to each:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consolidated Net Income (weighted at 75%): consolidated net income from  continuing operations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HDMC Asset Productivity (weighted at 12.5%): revenue from HDMC divided by  the sum of HDMC average property, plant and equipment, net and average HDMC Net  Working Capital
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HDMC Net Working Capital: consolidated accounts receivables plus the sum of  HDMC current assets consisting of inventories and other current assets (excluding  tax assets) less the sum of current liabilities consisting of accounts payable  (excluding negative book cash balances) and accrued liabilities (excluding dividends  payable and tax liabilities)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HDFS Return on Assets (weighted at 12.5%): HDFS operating income divided by  HDFS average finance receivables, net
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These measures are derived from our financial results as presented in our consolidated financial  statements and notes except that we use monthly information to calculate averages and our financial  statements and notes may not disclose detailed amounts for the excluded items because the details  are not required for financial statement reporting purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the 2017 Financial STIP , if we do not achieve net income of at least $480 million in 2017,  then we would not make any payouts, regardless of performance under other financial measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In  addition, the minimum payout could be 0%, the payout at the threshold level of performance is 50%  of a participants Financial STIP target opportunity, and the maximum payout would not exceed 200%  of a participants Financial STIP target opportunity, nor would such payout exceed $6 million per  executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee determined that there was a reasonable likelihood that employees could  achieve the goals and earn incentive compensation at the target performance level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also approved the 2017 Leadership STIP .
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEOs are able to earn the 2017 Leadership  STIP based upon improvement in project management along with goals to improve organizational  effectiveness and performance to plan on key strategic initiatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Combined payouts under the  Financial STIP and Leadership STIP cannot exceed 200% of a participants Financial STIP target  opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: L o n g - Te r m  I n c e n t i v e  P l a n
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Human Resources Committee believes that long-term incentives are a key component of total  compensation for participating executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of long-term incentives is to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) enhance the  growth and profitability of our company by focusing the senior leaders and other key employees on  our long-term financial success and growth in value, providing balance and perspective to annual  goals and incentives; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) further align the interests of shareholders and executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition,  the Committee believes that long-term incentives provide a valuable tool to retain and attract key  employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use objective market data that our outside executive compensation advisor provides  to assign to each key position, including each NEO, that is eligible to participate in the 2014 Incentive  Stock Plan a target value of long-term incentive opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HARLEY-DAVIDSON, INC. 2 0 1 7  P R O X Y  S TAT E M E N T 36
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: E X E C U T I V E  C O M P E N S AT I O N
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2 0 1 6  L o n g - Te r m  I n c e n t i v e  P l a n
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In December 2015, the Committee approved changes to the design of our long-term incentive  awards to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eliminate the granting of stock options (previously 33% of total award);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eliminate the granting of cash-based long-term incentive awards (previously 33% of  total award);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grant long-term performance share awards that vest according to our three-year  performance period goal achievement (67% of total award); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continue to grant time-vested restricted stock unit awards which will vest one-third per  year over each of the subsequent three years (33% of total award).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We implemented these changes to increase the focus on achievement of our long-term goals by  significantly increasing the portion of this compensation, such that executives will not receive value  without performance and directly tying the value they receive to performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, we provided long-term incentive compensation under our 2014 Incentive Stock  Plan, which gives the Human Resources Committee the flexibility to grant equity instruments,  including stock options, stock appreciation rights, restricted stock, restricted stock units and  performance shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The long-term incentive awards that we granted to certain senior leaders,  including all NEOs, used the design of our long-term incentive awards that the Committee approved in December 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: P e r f o r m a n c e  S h a r e s
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance shares that we granted in 2016 allow the executive to earn a specified number  of shares of our common stock at the end of the three-year performance period (2016 through  2018) that will range between 0% and 300% of the initial award amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each executives 2016  performance share award involves a stated number of performance shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of shares of  our stock that a NEO will earn will be determined at the end of a three-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a  result, the amount of performance shares a NEO earns is based on performance, and the value that  the NEO realizes is based on our stock price at that time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent that these awards vest, the  participant will receive the accumulated dividends which have accrued over the performance period in  direct proportion to the number of performance shares that actually vest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance measures applicable to the performance shares that we granted in 2016 are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cumulative Net Income (weighted at 42.5%): cumulative consolidated net income  from continuing operations over the performance period
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HDMC Average Return on Invested Capital (ROIC) (weighted at 42.5%): the sum of  the quotient obtained by, dividing
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) HDMC Net Operating Income After Tax by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) HDMC  Invested Capital for each year in the performance period, divided by the number of years  in the performance period
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HDMC Net Operating Income After Tax: the amount of HDMC operating  income reduced for taxes for the relevant year in the performance period
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HDMC Invested Capital: the average amount of HDMC debt plus the  average amount of HDMC shareholders equity, excluding accumulated other  comprehensive income or loss for pension and postretirement benefit plans, for the relevant year in the performance period
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: H A R L E Y- D A V I D S O N .
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: C O M 37
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: E X E C U T I V E  C O M P E N S AT I O N
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New Riders (weighted at 15%): the percentage of sales to new riders buying new  Harley-Davidson motorcycles in the U.S. compared to total new U.S. Harley-Davidson  sales for the preceding 12-month period ending November 1, 2018
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes the structure of this approach is in the best interest of our shareholders and  focuses behaviors on the realization of long-term strategic goals of the organization and the use of  shareholder capital to drive value creation and strong returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: R e s t r i c t e d  S t o c k  U n i t s
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that restricted stock unit awards complement our use of performance shares  by providing an effective and valuable tool to attract and retain senior leaders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted stock unit awards allow senior leaders, including our NEOs, to receive shares of our  common stock in the future only after the awards vest, which will occur only if the individual remains  an employee or certain other circumstances apply.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The restricted stock unit awards vest in three equal  annual installments beginning one year after the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the vesting period, the recipient  is eligible to receive dividend equivalents on a current basis on each restricted stock unit of the same  value as dividends that are declared and paid quarterly on each share of stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the vesting  rules of our restricted stock unit awards, a recipient who has attained the age of 55 and eligibility  for retirement and who retires from the company will have all awards that were granted 12 or more  months prior to the date of retirement vested upon retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: E q u i t y  A w a r d  G r a n t  P r o c e s s
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Human Resources Committee uses a methodology to calculate an individuals potential  aggregate long-term incentive award value that provides for a target value of long-term incentive  opportunity that we express as a percentage of base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, the Committee  reviewed competitive market data that Meridian prepared relating to the HDLT with Mr. Levatich.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based upon our compensation philosophy of targeting compensation at the 50th percentile plus or  minus 20% and based upon individual performance and experience, the Committee approved target  values of long-term incentive opportunities for NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target values for Messrs. Hund, Jones and  Olin were unchanged from 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We increased Ms. Kumbiers target value of long-term incentive  opportunity from 130% in 2015 to 170% in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based upon a review of the competitive market and  with input from Meridian, the Committee approved an increase in the amount of Mr. Levatichs target  value of long-term incentive opportunity from 425% to 450%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, we converted the target value of long-term incentive opportunity for each NEO into an  award of performance shares and an award of restricted stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For this conversion, we valued  each performance share and each restricted stock unit at an amount equal to the closing price of a  share of our stock on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We grant restricted stock units to a senior leader in a year  only if he or she met or exceeded objective and subjective performance standards that applied to him  or her in the preceding year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of 2016 grants, the Committee determined that all NEOs  met or exceeded applicable performance standards in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, there were no special grants to  any NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We describe the process and restrictions on granting long-term incentives more fully in the Corporate  Governance Principles and Board Matters - Human Resources Committee section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HARLEY-DAVIDSON, INC. 2 0 1 7  P R O X Y  S TAT E M E N T 38
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: E X E C U T I V E  C O M P E N S AT I O N
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2 0 1 4  t h r o u g h  2 0 1 6  C a s h - B a s e d  L o n g - Te r m  I n c e n t i v e  A w a r d s  ( P r o g r a m  d i s c o n t i n u e d  D e c e m b e r  3 1 ,  2 0 1 5 )
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In years prior to 2016, we granted cash-based long-term incentive awards relating to a three-year  performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2014, we granted this type of award to each NEO relating to performance over  2014, 2015 and 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payout was based on performance relative to goals relating to average  return on invested capital (ROIC) for HDMC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts could range from 0% to 200% of a NEOs target  value attributable to cash-based long-term incentive awards based upon results over the performance  period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ROIC performance calculation that we used in these cash-based long-term incentive  awards was as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HDMC Average Return on Invested Capital (ROIC): the sum of the quotient obtained  by dividing
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) HDMC Net Operating Income After Tax by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) HDMC Invested Capital for  each year in the performance period, divided by the number of years in the performance  period
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HDMC Net Operating Income After Tax: the amount of HDMC operating  income reduced for taxes for the relevant year in the performance period
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HDMC Invested Capital: the average amount of HDMC debt plus the  average amount of HDMC shareholders equity, excluding accumulated other  comprehensive income or loss for pension and postretirement benefit plans  and the cumulative effect of share repurchases above or below levels that we  reflected in our strategic plan at the time of the award, for the relevant year in the  performance period
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These measures are derived from our segment financial results as presented in the notes to our  consolidated financial statements, except that we do not disclose all of the information necessary to  make the calculation relating to share repurchase levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance period for the cash-based long-term incentive awards that we granted in 2014  ended on December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We paid those awards in February 2017 based upon ROIC for HDMC  compared to the goals that the Committee approved at the time of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target ROIC goal for  compensation purposes was 27.1% and actual ROIC performance was 22.9%, yielding a payment of  86% of each NEOs target value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2 0 1 7  L o n g - Te r m  I n c e n t i v e  P l a n  D e s i g n
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In November 2016, the Committee approved the design for long-term incentive awards to our NEOs  that was similar to the design for 2016 awards as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grant long-term performance share awards (67% of total award) with the potential to  earn 0% to 200% (for 2016, the upside limit was 300%); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grant restricted stock unit awards (33% of total award)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We used this mix to create substantial focus on achievement of the long-term success of the  company by having a significant portion of the compensation at risk such that executives will not  receive value without performance and to directly tie the value they receive to financial performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance shares that we granted in 2017 allow the executive to earn a specified number of  shares of our common stock at the end of the three-year performance period (2017 through 2019)  that will range between 0% and 200% of the initial award amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: H A R L E Y- D A V I D S O N .
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: E X E C U T I V E  C O M P E N S AT I O N
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance measures applicable to the 2017 awards of performance shares are as follows, in each case defined in a manner substantially similar to 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cumulative Net Income (weighted at 50%)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HDMC Average Return on Invested Capital (ROIC) (weighted at 50%)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HDMC Net Operating Income After Tax
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HDMC Invested Capital
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: E m p l o y e e  B e n e f i t s
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide other benefits to our senior leaders that we generally offer in similar form and manner to  our other salaried employees, including medical and dental benefits, life insurance-related benefits,  deferred compensation, retirement plans, employee savings plan, and relocation benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The goal of  these programs is to provide benefits that are competitive in the marketplace where we compete for  executives at the senior leadership level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, these benefits have been in place for a number  of years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: M e d i c a l  a n d  D e n t a l  B e n e f i t s
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide medical and dental benefit plans that are available to substantially all employees, including  the senior leaders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits-eligible HDMC U.S. salaried employees are also eligible to participate in  our Health Care Account Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not provide any supplemental medical or dental benefits to  our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: L i f e  I n s u r a n c e - R e l a t e d  B e n e f i t s
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide life insurance-related benefits to the senior leaders that are available only in the event of  their death during active employment with the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of life insurance-related benefits  ranges from one and one-half to three times a senior leaders annual base salary, depending on salary  band.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also reimburse executives for taxes on income that tax law imputes to executives related to  the provision of life insurance in excess of $50,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For non-executive salaried employees, we provide  life insurance-related benefits in the amount of one and one-half times base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: R e t i r e m e n t  P l a n s
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HDMC Salaried Defined Contribution Retirement Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For HDMC, we maintain a qualified defined contribution plan that covers HDMC U.S. salaried  employees who were hired on or after August 1, 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our Non-Qualified Deferred  Compensation Plan, we pay participants amounts that would have been accrued or payable under  this defined contribution plan if statutory limits that apply to this defined contribution plan as a qualified  plan under the Internal Revenue Code had not been applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Jones is a participant in this plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HDFS Defined Contribution Retirement Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For HDFS, we maintain a qualified defined contribution plan that covers HDFS U.S. employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Hund is a participant in this plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
